result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Amanda L Hogan.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court. 
Public Defender will be appointing counsel, but one has not been appointed.
Matter is adjourned. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court.  Court questions regarding non-representation. Court will proceed with the option of having the matter reheard.   Deputy Berres is sworn and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. Testifies that on January 17 he made contact with JCS who stated that she received information regarding a debt for rent.  Testifies that she did not rent from the company.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
